description: NCBI BioProject DB ID. A BioProject is a collection of biological data for a single initiative, originating from a single organization or from a consortium.
microbial or eukaryotic strain name
Database identifier assigned by repository and linked to GenBank or other repository.
Individual name of the fastq file involved in ngsQC or siteQC, or that is connected to a genome assembly id and subsequence fasta files in assemblyQC (i.e. SRR10971381_1.fastq)
Resource that the fastq files are derived from (i.e. SRA)
NCBI Assembly DB identifier.
This accession number is a unique identifier assigned to a record in sequence databases such as RefSeq (NCBI)

the number of reads that did not align to the reference as an exponent
Number of Genes per Organism

The total number of uncalled bases (N's) in the assembly.
The section of an organisms genome undergoing analysis (i.e. the gene, segement, chromosome, contig, etc.)

Length of the shortest read to minimally represent 95% of the assembly.
Length of the shortest read to minimally represent 75% of the assembly.
Number of reads that minimally represent 50% of the assembly.
Number of reads that minimally represent 75% of the assembly.
Summary statistics of percent assembly with 20x coverage, other summery statistics could also be used.
BLAST query coverage of the entire assembly between the assembly and reference sequences.
BLAST percent identity of the entire assembly between the assembly and reference sequences.

haploid, haploid-with-alt-loci (a haploid assembly with alternative loci, for example as provided by the Genome Reference Consortium for the human genome), diploid, unresolved diploid, or alternate pseudohaplotype. See the NCBI Assembly Data Model for a definition of these terms.
The highest level of assembly for any object in the assembly.
Internally developed scores used to evaluate the quality and / or quantity of the information present for a particular entry. Scoring criteria may vary per core data set
Name of instrument used for NGS.

Strategy/method used to generate the NGS. Controled vocabulary consisting of the following terms: WGA WGS WXS RNA-Seq miRNA-Seq WCS CLONE POOLCLONE AMPLICON CLONEEND FINISHING ChIP-Seq MNase-Seq DNase-Hypersensitivity Bisulfite-Seq Tn-Seq EST FL-cDNA CTS MRE-Seq MeDIP-Seq MBD-Seq Synthetic-Long-Read OTHER

Average quality (in phred score) of sequences in a FASTQ read file.
Length (in base pairs) of the shortest sequence(s) in a FASTA/FASTQ read file.
Count of positions the quality of which is significantly different (extremely low or high).
Number of unique reads that are not identical to other reads.
Average length of sequences in a FASTA/FASTQ read file.
Length (in base pairs) of longest sequence(s) present in a FASTA/FASTQ read file.

Level index for run specific depth first enumeration of tax hierarchy.
A list containing the different types of DNA sequences, including Standard, Vertebrate Mitochondrial, Yeast Mitochondrial, etc.

The relative frequency of sequences that are not protein coding for each DNA sequence type.
A list of density values of Ns per sequence read.

Percentage of sequences that are not complex.

Source of genomic information in the file. From an SRA controled vocabulary: GENOMIC: [Genomic DNA (includes PCR products from genomic DNA)], TRANSCRIPTOMIC: [Transcription products or non genomic DNA (EST, cDNA, RT-PCR, screened libraries)], METAGENOMIC : [Mixed material from metagenome], METATRANSCRIPTOMIC: [Transcription products from community targets], SYNTHETIC: [Synthetic DNA], VIRAL RNA: [Viral RNA], OTHER:[Other, unspecified, or unknown library source material (please include additional info in the ‚Äúdesign description‚Äù)]
